intro: Maranthes sanagensis, commonly known as the Sanagense maranthes, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence, which helps reduce water loss. Maranthes sanagensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display and unique foliage.
